did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Virginia Governor George F. Allen Policy Office Records, 1993-1998

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Governor George F. Allen Executive Office Records, 1993-1998. [Cite specific accession], State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Georgia Root, Assistant Secretary of the Commonwealth, Richmond, Virginia, 19 June 1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: George Felix Allen was born March 8, 1952 in Whittier, California to famed NFL football coach George H. Allen and his wife Henrietta (Lumbroso) Allen. He graduated from the University of Virginia in 1971 and the University of Virginia School of Law in 1977. Allen served in the Virginia House of Delegates from 1982-1991 and served a short term in the U.S. House of Delegates in the early 1990s. In November 1993, Allen beat Attorney General Mary Sue Terry to become Governor. Governor Allen served until January 1998 and was suceeded by Governor James S. Gilmore. Governor Allen has been married to Susan (Brown) Allen since 1986 and they have three children, Forrest, Tyler, and Brooke. The family resides in Mount Vernon, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, reports, speeches, minutes, and clippings related to various policies with which the Allen administration was concerned. The topics covered include federalism, federal government interference in Virginia affairs, education policies, the use of inmate labor, the proposed Walt Disney theme park in Prince William County, Virginia, and the Virginia-Israel Partnership. Also included are a variety of uncategorized files related to transportation issues, community development, environmental policy, the budget, and taxation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

did.unittitle: Series I. Federalism Files, 1994-1997.

scopecontent.p: Contains records documenting the Allen administration's efforts to reduce federal government influence on Virginia state government. The material documents administration efforts to address the perceived inbalance in power between the state and federal government. The records also include several files related to the activities of the Advisory Council on Self-Determination and Federalism. Additional records related to federal government interference can be found in Series IV. Federal Interference Files.

Series II. Education Files, 1994-1998.

scopecontent.p: Contains records concerning Allen administration educational policies and initiatives. This material contains information on Virginia Standards of Accreditation and Goals 2000. The records include speeches, memorandums, and press releases.

Series III. Inmate Labor Files, 1995-1997.

scopecontent.p: Contains reports, correspondence, news clippings, and speeches concerning the use of inmate labor under the Allen administration. The files include those related to the Community Work Project Program, the history of inmate labor in Virginia, and the establishment of Convicted Offenders Serving Virginia (CONSERV).

Series IV. Federal Interference Files, 1994-1996.

scopecontent.p: Contains records documenting perceived interference by the federal government in Commonwealth of Virginia affairs. Included are Federal Interference Assessments completed by secretariats and various departments. The assessments include information regarding the impact of state and federal mandates on local government, as well as analysis and recommendations put forth by the individual Cabinet Secretaries. Additional records related to federalism and states' rights can be found in Series I. Federalism Files.

Series V. Miscellaneous Files, 1993-1997.

scopecontent.p: Contains a variety of records including reports, correspondence, and memoranda. Included are documents concerning budget issues, transportation issues, crime, the environment, and tax policy. Records regarding the Secretariats of Commerce and Trade and Health and Human Resources are available, as are folders devoted to the Governor's Commission on Competitive and Equitable Tax Policy.

Series VI. Disney's America Files, 1994.

scopecontent.p: Contains documents related to Walt Disney's proposed Disney's America history theme park in Prince William County, Virginia. The Walt Disney company drew up plans for a history theme park in the early 1990s, but the project was eventually canceled. The project was supported by Governor Allen, but it was criticized for its proximity to Manassas National Battlefield Park, and for promoting "corporate history," a toned-down version of actual events skewed for entertainment purposes. Records include news clippings, speeches, testimony, correspondence, and press conference material.

Series VII. Virginia-Israel Partnership Files, 1994-1997.

scopecontent.p: Contains records related to the Virginia-Israel Partnership, which was created by Governor George Allen in 1995. This partnership was established to explore opportunities to expand economic and cultural links between the Commonwealth of Virginia and the State of Israel and to advise the Governor's Office on such matters. Records include correspondence, reports, minutes, and clippings.
